section.title: Past Simple of to be
section.sectiontitle: The Past Simple of the verb to be is was or were.
section.text1a: My hair was red 20 years ago.
section.sectiontitle2: Make negatives with not. We usually use contractions.
section.text3: My hair was not grey 20 years ago.
section.text3a: My hair wasn't grey 20 years ago.
section.text4: They were not at the cinema yesterday.
section.text4a: They weren't at the cinema yesterday.

section.title: Past Simple of to be
section.sectiontitle: Put was/were before the subject to make questions.
section.text1: Karin was at the office on Monday.
section.text1a: Was Karin at the office on Monday?
section.text2: You were at the park last night.
section.sectiontitle2: Use was, wasn't, were and weren't to make short answers to questions.
section.text3a: Yes, he was. No, he wasn't.
section.text4a: Yes, they were. No, they weren't.

section.title: Past Simple of regular verbs: affirmative
section.sectiontitle: Add -ed to regular verbs to make the past simple.
section.text1: Simon works at the hotel in the village.
section.text1a: Simon worked at the hotel in the village last summer.
section.text2: We watch DVDs in the evening.
section.text2a: We watched a DVD yesterday evening.
section.sectiontitle2: Some regular verbs have different Past Simple endings. These are verbs that end in -e, consonant + -y, or one vowel + one consonant.
section.text3: We liv<Font color='#A6416E'>e</Font> in Paris but we stud<Font color='#A6416E'>y</Font> in Bordeaux.
section.text3a: We lived in Paris but we studied in Bordeaux.
section.text4: Janine and Jeremy pla<Font color='#A6416E'>n</Font> to get married.
section.text4a: Janine and Jeremy planned to get married.
